availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Married to Armilda Moores. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as 3rd Sergeant from October 9, 1861 to March 16, 1862. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Sergeant from March 16, 1862 to December 24, 1862. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as 2nd Lieutenant from December 24, 1862 to

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 187.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #9189951, Certificate #685180.
Find A Grave, "CPT James Alexander Moores (1838-1909)," Memorial #26495947, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26495947 (accessed August 4, 2020).
